67.heading: Defamation.
67.title: "The Library of Souls"
67.author: art: Jim Aparo ; script: Peter Milligan ; colorist: Adrienne Roy ; letterer: Jim Aparo
notes: Summary: A murderer, who says he can "read people like a book," establishes the occupation of each victim and leaves the bodies in jackets with three-digit numbers on them. One of the victims is found in a library, and Batman notices the Dewey numbers on the books. He guesses that the killer is a librarian, though the librarian explaining the classification system to him disagrees: "That's a defamation of character. Libarians are gentle, bookish souls." But Batman is correct.
Data from Bill Wormstedt, et al., via Grand Comic-Book Database Project.
Cover title: Psycho Climax Studios presents Darkseed and Other Defamations.

85.heading: Defeating the System.
85.title: "Tiamotti!"
85.author: art by Liberatore ; written by Stefano Tamburini
85.appears_in: p. 61-67 in Video Clips (New York : Catalan Communicatons, 1985).
notes: Summary: Psychic probes around the city detect subversive thoughts, so that the thinkers can be eliminated. Each probe is connected to a policeman, who is welded to a machine gun. The policemen can only shoot if the probe detects mental subversion, however, and the protagonists try to defeat the system by not thinking about what they are doing.
